entries.name: Fever
entries.definition: Elevated body temperature above normal.
entries.pathophysiology: Pyrogen-mediated hypothalamic reset.
management: Hospitalize if unstable or red flags

entries.name: Fatigue
entries.definition: Persistent sense of tiredness or lack of energy.
entries.pathophysiology: Multifactorial: metabolic, inflammatory, psychological.

entries.name: Unintentional weight loss
entries.definition: Loss of body weight without trying.
entries.pathophysiology: Catabolism, malabsorption, increased metabolic demand, hormonal imbalance.

entries.name: Weight Gain (Unintentional)
entries.definition: Increase in body weight without intentional effort.
entries.pathophysiology: Fluid retention, fat accumulation, metabolic.

entries.name: Night Sweats
entries.definition: Excessive sweating during sleep.
entries.pathophysiology: Autonomic dysregulation, cytokines.

entries.name: Chills/Rigors
entries.definition: Sensation of cold with shivering, often with fever.
entries.pathophysiology: Cytokine release, pyrogenic response.

entries.name: Malaise
entries.definition: General feeling of discomfort or unease.
entries.pathophysiology: Systemic inflammation, cytokines.

entries.name: Anorexia (Loss of Appetite)
entries.definition: Reduced desire to eat.
entries.pathophysiology: Cytokine-mediated, GI, psychiatric.

entries.name: Generalized Weakness
entries.definition: Diffuse reduction in muscle strength/energy.
entries.pathophysiology: Metabolic, neuromuscular, inflammatory.

entries.name: Lymphadenopathy (Generalized)
entries.definition: Enlargement of multiple lymph nodes.
entries.pathophysiology: Immune activation, neoplastic infiltration.

entries.name: Chest Pain
entries.definition: Discomfort or pain in the chest, may radiate to neck, jaw, or arms.
entries.pathophysiology: Myocardial ischemia, inflammation, structural or functional chest wall or visceral involvement.

entries.name: Dyspnea
entries.definition: Subjective sensation of breathlessness at rest or exertion.
entries.pathophysiology: Pulmonary congestion, reduced cardiac output, hypoxemia.

entries.name: Palpitations
entries.definition: Awareness of abnormal heart rhythm.
entries.pathophysiology: Ectopic beats, tachyarrhythmias, increased sympathetic tone.
characteristics: May have dizziness, chest discomfort, anxiety

entries.name: Syncope
entries.definition: Transient loss of consciousness due to cerebral hypoperfusion.
entries.pathophysiology: Sudden drop in cardiac output or blood pressure.
characteristics: May have incontinence or myoclonic jerks

entries.name: Peripheral Edema
entries.definition: Swelling of lower limbs or other tissues.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased hydrostatic pressure, decreased oncotic pressure, lymphatic obstruction.

entries.name: Orthopnea
entries.definition: Shortness of breath when lying flat.
entries.pathophysiology: Pulmonary congestion increases in recumbency.

entries.name: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Dyspnea
entries.definition: Sudden breathlessness at night that wakes the patient.
entries.pathophysiology: Redistribution of fluid to lungs during sleep.
characteristics: Wakes after 1–2 hours of sleep gasping

entries.name: Intermittent Claudication
entries.definition: Cramping pain in legs with exertion, relieved by rest.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced arterial blood flow to muscles.

entries.name: Cyanosis
entries.definition: Bluish discoloration of skin/mucosa.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced oxygen saturation in blood.

entries.name: Fatigue
entries.definition: Persistent tiredness not relieved by rest.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced cardiac output, decreased oxygen delivery, metabolic derangement.

entries.name: Cough
entries.definition: Forceful expulsion of air from the lungs, may be productive or dry.
entries.pathophysiology: Airway irritation, inflammation, mucus production.
characteristics: Aggravating: lying down, exertion, cold air

entries.name: Hemoptysis
entries.definition: Coughing up blood from the respiratory tract.
entries.pathophysiology: Erosion of airway or vessel, inflammation, or tumor invasion.
management: IR embolization or surgery for massive cases

entries.name: Dyspnea (Shortness of Breath)
entries.definition: Subjective sensation of difficult or uncomfortable breathing.
entries.pathophysiology: Airflow obstruction, alveolar filling, reduced oxygenation, increased work of breathing.

entries.name: Wheezing
entries.definition: High-pitched whistling sound during breathing, usually expiratory.
entries.pathophysiology: Airway narrowing, bronchospasm, mucus plugging.

entries.name: Stridor
entries.definition: Harsh, vibratory inspiratory sound indicating upper airway obstruction.
entries.pathophysiology: Obstruction of upper airway causing turbulent airflow.

entries.name: Sputum Production
entries.definition: Expectoration of mucus or phlegm from the lower airways.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal inflammation with increased mucus secretion.

entries.name: Chest Pain (Pleuritic)
entries.definition: Sharp, stabbing pain worsened by breathing or coughing.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation/irritation of parietal pleura.

entries.name: Orthopnea (Respiratory)
entries.definition: Dyspnea when lying flat, relieved by sitting up.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased venous return and pulmonary congestion; reduced respiratory muscle function.

entries.name: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Dyspnea (Respiratory)
entries.definition: Sudden breathlessness at night that wakes the patient.
entries.pathophysiology: Fluid redistribution to lungs during sleep; bronchospasm; upper airway collapse.
characteristics: Wakes after 1–2 hrs of sleep gasping

entries.name: Cyanosis (Respiratory)
entries.definition: Bluish discoloration of skin/mucosa due to hypoxemia.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced oxygen saturation in blood.

entries.name: Nausea
entries.definition: Unpleasant sensation in the stomach with urge to vomit.
entries.pathophysiology: Stimulation of vomiting center in medulla.
management: Admit if severe or unable to tolerate PO

entries.name: Vomiting
entries.definition: Forceful expulsion of gastric contents through the mouth.
entries.pathophysiology: Activation of vomiting center, reverse peristalsis.

entries.name: Dysphagia
entries.definition: Difficulty swallowing solids, liquids, or both.
entries.pathophysiology: Obstruction or motility disorder of esophagus.

entries.name: Odynophagia
entries.definition: Painful swallowing.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal injury or inflammation.
characteristics: Burning or sharp pain with swallowing
management: Admit if unable to tolerate PO

entries.name: Heartburn (Pyrosis)
entries.definition: Burning retrosternal discomfort, often postprandial.
entries.pathophysiology: Reflux of gastric acid into esophagus.

entries.name: Hiccups (Gastrointestinal)
entries.definition: Involuntary, repetitive contractions of the diaphragm.
entries.pathophysiology: Phrenic/vagus nerve irritation, CNS stimulation.

entries.name: Belching (Eructation)
entries.definition: Audible escape of air from the stomach through the mouth.
entries.pathophysiology: Swallowing/excess air, delayed gastric emptying.

entries.name: Bloating
entries.definition: Sensation of abdominal fullness or distension.
entries.pathophysiology: Gas accumulation, delayed transit, visceral hypersensitivity.

entries.name: Flatulence
entries.definition: Excessive passage of gas per rectum.
entries.pathophysiology: Bacterial fermentation, maldigestion, rapid transit.

entries.name: Anorexia (Loss of Appetite)
entries.definition: Reduced desire to eat.
entries.pathophysiology: Altered hypothalamic signaling; cytokine effects.

entries.name: Dysuria
entries.definition: Painful or difficult urination.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation or irritation of the lower urinary tract.

entries.name: Hematuria
entries.definition: Blood in urine (gross or microscopic).
entries.pathophysiology: Bleeding from any part of the urinary tract.

entries.name: Pyuria
entries.definition: Presence of pus (WBCs) in urine.
entries.pathophysiology: Infection or inflammation of the urinary tract.

entries.name: Proteinuria
entries.definition: Excess protein in urine.
entries.pathophysiology: Glomerular or tubular dysfunction.

entries.name: Nocturia
entries.definition: Waking at night to urinate.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased nighttime urine production or decreased bladder capacity.

entries.name: Polyuria
entries.definition: Excessive urine output (>3L/day).
entries.pathophysiology: Osmotic diuresis, impaired ADH function, or excessive intake.

entries.name: Oliguria
entries.definition: Decreased urine output (<400 mL/day).
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced renal perfusion or obstruction.

entries.name: Anuria
entries.definition: Near/complete absence of urine output (<100 mL/day).
entries.pathophysiology: Complete loss of renal function or urinary tract obstruction.

entries.name: Urgency
entries.definition: Sudden, compelling urge to urinate.
entries.pathophysiology: Detrusor overactivity or bladder irritation.

entries.name: Frequency
entries.definition: Increased number of voids per day (>8/day).
entries.pathophysiology: Bladder irritation, increased urine production, or reduced capacity.

entries.name: Cloudy urine
entries.definition: Urine that appears turbid or milky rather than clear.
entries.pathophysiology: Leukocytes/bacteria/crystals or particulate matter in urine scatter light.

entries.name: Foul-smelling urine
entries.definition: Urine with an unpleasant or strong odor.
entries.pathophysiology: Bacterial metabolism, concentrated urine, or metabolic byproducts.

entries.name: Dark urine
entries.definition: Urine that is brown, tea-colored, or deep yellow.
entries.pathophysiology: Concentrated urine or presence of blood, bile pigments, myoglobin, or drugs.

entries.name: Dribbling
entries.definition: Involuntary leakage of small amounts of urine, often after voiding.
entries.pathophysiology: Incomplete emptying or impaired sphincter control leads to retention and leakage.

entries.name: Hesitancy
entries.definition: Delay or difficulty in initiating urination.
entries.pathophysiology: Bladder outlet obstruction or impaired detrusor contractility delays flow.

entries.name: Weak urine stream
entries.definition: Reduced force and volume of urinary flow.
entries.pathophysiology: Obstruction or impaired detrusor contraction reduces flow rate.

entries.name: Split urine stream
entries.definition: Urine stream divides into two or more jets during voiding.
entries.pathophysiology: Narrowing/irregularity at meatus or urethra disrupts flow.

entries.name: Urinary urgency incontinence
entries.definition: Involuntary leakage accompanied by or immediately preceded by urgency.
entries.pathophysiology: Detrusor overactivity causes involuntary contractions and leakage.
characteristics: Inability to reach toilet in time

entries.name: Stress incontinence
entries.definition: Involuntary leakage on effort, exertion, sneezing, or coughing.
entries.pathophysiology: Raised intra-abdominal pressure overcomes urethral sphincter resistance.

entries.name: Overflow incontinence
entries.definition: Involuntary urine leakage due to overdistended bladder, often without urge.
entries.pathophysiology: Chronic retention leads to bladder overdistension and small-volume leakage.

entries.name: Headache
entries.definition: Pain in the head or upper neck.
entries.pathophysiology: Nociceptive activation in cranial structures.

entries.name: Dizziness/Vertigo
entries.definition: Sensation of spinning or imbalance.
entries.pathophysiology: Dysfunction of vestibular system or central pathways.

entries.name: Seizure
entries.definition: Sudden, uncontrolled electrical activity in the brain.
entries.pathophysiology: Abnormal neuronal discharge.

entries.name: Syncope
entries.definition: Transient loss of consciousness due to cerebral hypoperfusion.
entries.pathophysiology: Sudden drop in cerebral perfusion.

entries.name: Weakness (Focal)
entries.definition: Reduced strength in a specific body area.
entries.pathophysiology: Central or peripheral nervous system lesion.

entries.name: Numbness/Paresthesia
entries.definition: Abnormal sensation such as tingling or pins and needles.
entries.pathophysiology: Nerve injury or dysfunction.

entries.name: Memory Loss
entries.definition: Impaired ability to recall information.
entries.pathophysiology: Neurodegeneration, metabolic, structural, or psychiatric processes.

entries.name: Ataxia
entries.definition: Impaired coordination or balance.
entries.pathophysiology: Cerebellar or sensory pathway dysfunction.

entries.name: Tremor
entries.definition: Involuntary, rhythmic muscle oscillation.
entries.pathophysiology: Basal ganglia or cerebellar dysfunction.

entries.name: Visual Disturbance
entries.definition: Impaired vision (blurred, loss, double).
entries.pathophysiology: Ocular, optic nerve, or brain lesion.

entries.name: Aphasia
entries.definition: Impaired language comprehension or production.
entries.pathophysiology: Lesion in dominant cerebral hemisphere (usually left).

entries.name: Dysarthria
entries.definition: Impaired articulation of speech.
entries.pathophysiology: Motor pathway or muscle dysfunction.

entries.name: Dysphagia (Neurogenic)
entries.definition: Difficulty swallowing due to neurologic cause.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired coordination of swallowing muscles.

entries.name: Diplopia
entries.definition: Double vision.
entries.pathophysiology: Extraocular muscle or nerve dysfunction.

entries.name: Facial Weakness
entries.definition: Weakness of facial muscles.
entries.pathophysiology: Cranial nerve VII dysfunction (central or peripheral).

entries.name: Ptosis
entries.definition: Drooping of the upper eyelid.
entries.pathophysiology: Levator muscle or nerve dysfunction.

entries.name: Myoclonus
entries.definition: Sudden, brief, involuntary muscle jerks.
entries.pathophysiology: Hyperexcitability of CNS neurons.

entries.name: Chorea
entries.definition: Involuntary, irregular, purposeless movements.
entries.pathophysiology: Basal ganglia dysfunction.

entries.name: Dystonia
entries.definition: Sustained or intermittent muscle contractions causing abnormal postures.
entries.pathophysiology: Basal ganglia or CNS dysfunction.
management: Deep brain stimulation for refractory cases

entries.name: Tics
entries.definition: Sudden, rapid, recurrent, nonrhythmic motor movements or vocalizations.
entries.pathophysiology: Basal ganglia neurotransmitter imbalance.

entries.name: Arthralgia
entries.definition: Joint pain without overt inflammation.
entries.pathophysiology: Mechanical, inflammatory, or metabolic insult to joint tissues.

entries.name: Fatigue with movement
entries.definition: Persistent or recurrent sense of tiredness, lack of energy, or exhaustion that is notably triggered or worsened by physical activity or movement.
entries.pathophysiology: Multifactorial: impaired oxygen delivery/utilization, metabolic derangements, chronic inflammation, neuroendocrine or psychological factors, reduced muscle strength/endurance.
characteristics: May have muscle weakness or shortness of breath on exertion
management: Refer to specialist if red flags or unclear etiology

entries.name: Myalgia
entries.definition: Muscle pain.
entries.pathophysiology: Muscle fiber inflammation, injury, or metabolic dysfunction.

entries.name: Back Pain
entries.definition: Pain in the back (cervical, thoracic, lumbar).
entries.pathophysiology: Muscle, ligament, disc, or bone injury/inflammation.

entries.name: Neck Pain
entries.definition: Pain in the cervical region.
entries.pathophysiology: Muscle, ligament, disc, or bone injury/inflammation.

entries.name: Joint Swelling
entries.definition: Visible or palpable enlargement of a joint.
entries.pathophysiology: Synovial inflammation, effusion, or bleeding.

entries.name: Morning Stiffness
entries.definition: Stiffness after rest, often in the morning.
entries.pathophysiology: Synovial or periarticular inflammation.

entries.name: Deformity (Musculoskeletal)
entries.definition: Abnormal shape or alignment of bone/joint.
entries.pathophysiology: Structural damage or malformation.

entries.name: Muscle Weakness
entries.definition: Reduced muscle strength.
entries.pathophysiology: Muscle or nerve dysfunction.

entries.name: Bone Pain
entries.definition: Pain localized to bone.
entries.pathophysiology: Structural, metabolic, or infiltrative bone pathology.

entries.name: Joint Instability
entries.definition: Excessive movement or giving way of a joint.
entries.pathophysiology: Ligamentous laxity or disruption.

entries.name: Joint Locking
entries.definition: Inability to fully extend or flex a joint.
entries.pathophysiology: Mechanical obstruction within joint.

entries.name: Crepitus
entries.definition: Grating or crackling sound/sensation in joint.
entries.pathophysiology: Irregular articular surfaces, air in joint.

entries.name: Joint Deformity
entries.definition: Abnormal shape or alignment of a joint.
entries.pathophysiology: Chronic inflammation, structural damage.

entries.name: Swelling of Soft Tissue
entries.definition: Enlargement of non-joint soft tissue.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, fluid accumulation, mass effect.

entries.name: Muscle Cramps
entries.definition: Sudden, involuntary muscle contraction.
entries.pathophysiology: Hyperexcitability of muscle fibers/nerves.

entries.name: Muscle Atrophy
entries.definition: Loss of muscle bulk.
entries.pathophysiology: Denervation or disuse, muscle fiber loss.

entries.name: Contracture
entries.definition: Permanent shortening of muscle/tendon.
entries.pathophysiology: Fibrosis, muscle imbalance, joint capsule tightening.

entries.name: Limb pain
entries.definition: Pain localized to an arm or leg, may be acute or chronic, sharp, dull, or burning.
entries.pathophysiology: Nociceptive, neuropathic, or ischemic mechanisms; inflammation, nerve injury, or tissue damage.
characteristics: Aching, sharp, burning, or throbbing pain

entries.name: Arm/hand weakness
entries.definition: Reduced strength in the arm or hand, may affect grip or movement.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of motor pathways (central or peripheral), muscle or neuromuscular junction disease.

entries.name: Rash
entries.definition: Visible skin eruption.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, immune response, infection.

entries.name: Pruritus
entries.definition: Itching sensation.
entries.pathophysiology: Histamine release, nerve irritation, systemic disease.

entries.name: Ulcer
entries.definition: Loss of skin surface with tissue necrosis.
entries.pathophysiology: Ischemia, infection, trauma.

entries.name: Hirsutism
entries.definition: Excess terminal hair in women in a male pattern.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased androgen production or sensitivity.

entries.name: Fissure
entries.definition: Linear crack or split in the skin extending into the dermis.
entries.pathophysiology: Loss of skin elasticity and moisture, chronic inflammation, repetitive trauma.

entries.name: Nodules
entries.definition: Solid, raised skin lesions >1 cm.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammatory or neoplastic proliferation.

entries.name: Scaling
entries.definition: Flaking of skin surface.
entries.pathophysiology: Hyperproliferation or inflammation.

entries.name: Hair Loss (Alopecia)
entries.definition: Partial or complete hair loss.
entries.pathophysiology: Follicular miniaturization, autoimmune destruction, stress.

entries.name: Nail Changes
entries.definition: Alterations in nail color, texture, or shape.
entries.pathophysiology: Nail matrix or bed pathology.

entries.name: Photosensitivity
entries.definition: Abnormal skin reaction to sunlight.
entries.pathophysiology: Immune-mediated or DNA repair defect.

entries.name: Acneiform Eruptions
entries.definition: Papules/pustules resembling acne.
entries.pathophysiology: Follicular hyperkeratinization, inflammation, infection.

entries.name: Urticaria (Hives)
entries.definition: Transient, pruritic, raised wheals.
entries.pathophysiology: Mast cell degranulation, histamine release.

entries.name: Erythema
entries.definition: Redness of skin due to increased blood flow.
entries.pathophysiology: Vasodilation, inflammation.

entries.name: Livedo Reticularis
entries.definition: Mottled, net-like skin discoloration.
entries.pathophysiology: Vascular obstruction, vasospasm.

entries.name: Blistering (Bullous) Disorders
entries.definition: Large fluid-filled lesions due to skin separation.
entries.pathophysiology: Autoimmune or physical disruption of skin layers.

entries.name: Hyperkeratosis
entries.definition: Thickening of the stratum corneum.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased keratin production.

entries.name: Hypohidrosis/Anhidrosis
entries.definition: Decreased/absent sweating.
entries.pathophysiology: Sweat gland or nerve dysfunction.

entries.name: Hyperhidrosis
entries.definition: Excessive sweating.
entries.pathophysiology: Overactive sweat glands, autonomic dysfunction.

entries.name: Bullae
entries.definition: Large, fluid-filled blisters (>5 mm) within or beneath the epidermis.
entries.pathophysiology: Loss of cohesion between skin layers due to immune attack, toxins, or trauma.

entries.name: Vesicles
entries.definition: Small, fluid-filled blisters (<5 mm) within or beneath the epidermis.
entries.pathophysiology: Intraepidermal or subepidermal fluid accumulation due to infection, inflammation, or injury.

entries.name: Anemia
entries.definition: Low hemoglobin or RBC count.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased production, increased destruction, or loss of RBCs.

entries.name: Leukopenia
entries.definition: Low white blood cell count.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased production or increased destruction of WBCs.

entries.name: Leukocytosis
entries.definition: Elevated white blood cell count.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased production/release of WBCs.

entries.name: Thrombocytopenia
entries.definition: Low platelet count.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased production, increased destruction, or sequestration.

entries.name: Thrombocytosis
entries.definition: Elevated platelet count.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased production/reactive.

entries.name: Neutropenia
entries.definition: Low neutrophil count.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased production or increased destruction.

entries.name: Lymphadenopathy
entries.definition: Enlarged lymph nodes.
entries.pathophysiology: Hyperplasia, infiltration, inflammation.

entries.name: Splenomegaly
entries.definition: Enlarged spleen.
entries.pathophysiology: Hyperplasia, infiltration, congestion.

entries.name: Hemolysis
entries.definition: Premature destruction of RBCs.
entries.pathophysiology: Intrinsic or extrinsic RBC destruction.

entries.name: Pancytopenia
entries.definition: Reduction in all blood cell lines.
entries.pathophysiology: Marrow suppression or destruction.

entries.name: Polycythemia
entries.definition: Increased RBC mass/hemoglobin.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased erythropoiesis or decreased plasma.

entries.name: Bleeding Diathesis
entries.definition: Increased tendency to bleed.
entries.pathophysiology: Coagulation factor deficiency, platelet dysfunction.

entries.name: Lymphocytosis
entries.definition: Elevated lymphocyte count.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased production or redistribution.

entries.name: Lymphopenia
entries.definition: Low lymphocyte count.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased production or increased destruction.

entries.name: Eosinophilia
entries.definition: Elevated eosinophil count.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased production in marrow.

entries.name: Basophilia
entries.definition: Elevated basophil count.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased marrow production.

entries.name: Monocytosis
entries.definition: Elevated monocyte count.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased marrow production.

entries.name: Neutrophilia
entries.definition: Elevated neutrophil count.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased marrow production/release.
management: Hematology referral if persistent or blasts present

entries.name: Pallor
entries.definition: Paleness of skin/mucosa due to reduced oxyhemoglobin.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced hemoglobin or blood flow.

entries.name: Fatigue
entries.definition: Persistent sense of tiredness or lack of energy.
entries.pathophysiology: Multifactorial: metabolic, inflammatory, psychological.

entries.name: Hyperglycemia
entries.definition: Elevated blood glucose.
entries.pathophysiology: Insulin deficiency/resistance.

entries.name: Hypoglycemia
entries.definition: Low blood glucose.
entries.pathophysiology: Excess insulin, hormone deficiency, critical illness.

entries.name: Hypernatremia
entries.definition: Elevated serum sodium.
entries.pathophysiology: Water loss > sodium loss.

entries.name: Hyponatremia
entries.definition: Low serum sodium.
entries.pathophysiology: Water retention or sodium loss.

entries.name: Hyperkalemia
entries.definition: Elevated serum potassium.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired excretion or shift out of cells.

entries.name: Hypokalemia
entries.definition: Low serum potassium.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased loss or shift into cells.

entries.name: Hypercalcemia
entries.definition: Elevated serum calcium.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased bone resorption, GI absorption, or decreased renal excretion.

entries.name: Hypocalcemia
entries.definition: Low serum calcium.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased PTH/vitamin D, increased loss.

entries.name: Hyperphosphatemia
entries.definition: Elevated serum phosphate.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased excretion, increased release.

entries.name: Hypophosphatemia
entries.definition: Low serum phosphate.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased intake/absorption, increased loss.

entries.name: Hypermagnesemia
entries.definition: Elevated serum magnesium.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased excretion, increased intake.

entries.name: Hypomagnesemia
entries.definition: Low serum magnesium.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased intake/absorption, increased loss.

entries.name: Hyperandrogenism (Female)
entries.definition: Excess androgen effects in females.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased androgen production.

entries.name: Hyperlipidemia
entries.definition: Elevated blood lipids.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased production/decreased clearance.

entries.name: Fatigue
entries.definition: Persistent sense of tiredness or lack of energy not relieved by rest.
entries.pathophysiology: Multifactorial: metabolic, hormonal, inflammatory, psychological.

entries.name: Weakness
entries.definition: Diffuse reduction in muscle strength or energy.
entries.pathophysiology: Metabolic, neuromuscular, hormonal, inflammatory.

entries.name: Unintentional weight loss
entries.definition: Loss of body weight without trying.
entries.pathophysiology: Catabolism, malabsorption, increased metabolic demand, hormonal imbalance.

entries.name: Unintentional weight gain
entries.definition: Increase in body weight without intentional effort.
entries.pathophysiology: Fluid retention, fat accumulation, metabolic/hormonal imbalance.

entries.name: Polyuria
entries.definition: Excessive urine output (>3L/day adults).
entries.pathophysiology: Osmotic diuresis (glucose), ADH dysfunction, renal concentrating defect.

entries.name: Polydipsia
entries.definition: Excessive thirst or fluid intake.
entries.pathophysiology: Osmotic diuresis, hypothalamic dysfunction, increased plasma osmolality.

entries.name: Red Eye
entries.definition: Conjunctival/ocular redness.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, infection, vascular congestion.

entries.name: Eye Pain
entries.definition: Ocular/periocular discomfort.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, increased IOP, nerve irritation.

entries.name: Visual Loss (Acute)
entries.definition: Sudden decrease in vision.
entries.pathophysiology: Retinal/optic nerve dysfunction, vascular occlusion.
management: Treat cause (e.g., laser, surgery, steroids, thrombolysis)

entries.name: Visual Loss (Chronic)
entries.definition: Gradual decrease in vision.
entries.pathophysiology: Progressive retinal/optic nerve damage.
management: Treat cause (surgery, laser, anti-VEGF, IOP lowering)

entries.name: Photophobia
entries.definition: Light-induced ocular discomfort.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation of iris/cornea, trigeminal nerve sensitization.

entries.name: Diplopia
entries.definition: Double vision.
entries.pathophysiology: Extraocular muscle dysfunction, nerve palsy.

entries.name: Proptosis
entries.definition: Forward displacement of the eye.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased orbital content/pressure.

entries.name: Eyelid Swelling
entries.definition: Swelling of eyelid tissues.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, infection, allergic reaction.

entries.name: Tearing (Epiphora)
entries.definition: Excessive tearing.
entries.pathophysiology: Obstruction, hypersecretion, poor drainage.

entries.name: Floaters/Flashes
entries.definition: Perception of moving spots/lights.
entries.pathophysiology: Vitreous or retinal pathology.

entries.name: Scotoma
entries.definition: Area of partial alteration in the visual field.
entries.pathophysiology: Localized retinal/optic nerve dysfunction.
management: Urgent referral if acute vision loss

entries.name: Nystagmus
entries.definition: Involuntary rhythmic eye movements.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of ocular motor control.

entries.name: Ptosis
entries.definition: Drooping of the upper eyelid.
entries.pathophysiology: Muscle/nerve dysfunction.

entries.name: Anisocoria
entries.definition: Unequal pupil sizes.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of sympathetic/parasympathetic pathways.

entries.name: Photopsia
entries.definition: Perception of flashes of light.
entries.pathophysiology: Retinal or cortical stimulation.

entries.name: Amaurosis Fugax
entries.definition: Transient monocular vision loss.
entries.pathophysiology: Transient retinal ischemia.

entries.name: Papilledema
entries.definition: Optic disc swelling due to raised intracranial pressure.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired axoplasmic flow in optic nerve.

entries.name: Hyphema
entries.definition: Blood in the anterior chamber of the eye.
entries.pathophysiology: Rupture of iris/ciliary blood vessels.

entries.name: Blurred Vision
entries.definition: Loss of sharpness or clarity of vision.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of light transmission, retinal or optic nerve dysfunction.
characteristics: Gradual or sudden decrease in visual acuity
management: Urgent ophthalmology referral if acute loss

entries.name: Eye Discharge
entries.definition: Abnormal fluid exuding from the eye.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation or infection of conjunctiva or lacrimal system increases secretion.
management: Urgent referral if severe pain/vision loss

entries.name: Otalgia (Ear Pain)
entries.definition: Pain in or around the ear.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, infection, neuralgia.

entries.name: Hearing Loss (Acute)
entries.definition: Sudden reduction in hearing.
entries.pathophysiology: Conductive or sensorineural dysfunction.

entries.name: Hearing Loss (Chronic)
entries.definition: Gradual reduction in hearing.
entries.pathophysiology: Degeneration of cochlea, ossicles, or nerve.

entries.name: Tinnitus
entries.definition: Perception of noise/ringing in ears.
entries.pathophysiology: Aberrant auditory pathway activity.

entries.name: Vertigo
entries.definition: Illusion of movement/spinning.
entries.pathophysiology: Peripheral or central vestibular dysfunction.

entries.name: Nasal Obstruction
entries.definition: Blocked nasal airflow.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal swelling, mass, structural.

entries.name: Epistaxis
entries.definition: Nosebleed.
entries.pathophysiology: Vessel rupture, mucosal injury.

entries.name: Rhinorrhea
entries.definition: Nasal discharge.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased secretion or impaired drainage.

entries.name: Sore Throat (Pharyngitis)
entries.definition: Pain or discomfort in the throat.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal inflammation/infection.

entries.name: Hoarseness (Dysphonia)
entries.definition: Abnormal voice quality.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, mass, nerve dysfunction.

entries.name: Dysphagia (ENT)
entries.definition: Difficulty swallowing.
entries.pathophysiology: Obstruction or motility disorder.
management: Urgent ENT referral if airway risk

entries.name: Odynophagia (ENT)
entries.definition: Painful swallowing.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal injury, infection, inflammation.

entries.name: Oral Ulcer
entries.definition: Mucosal break in oral cavity.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal injury, infection, immune.

entries.name: Anosmia/Hyposmia
entries.definition: Loss/reduction of sense of smell.
entries.pathophysiology: Damage to olfactory epithelium/nerves.

entries.name: Neck Mass
entries.definition: Palpable mass in neck.
entries.pathophysiology: Infection, neoplasm, congenital.

entries.name: Stridor (ENT)
entries.definition: Harsh, vibratory sound due to upper airway obstruction.
entries.pathophysiology: Airway narrowing.

entries.name: Trismus
entries.definition: Inability to open mouth fully.
entries.pathophysiology: Spasm of masticatory muscles.

entries.name: Halitosis
entries.definition: Offensive breath odor.
entries.pathophysiology: Bacterial overgrowth, volatile compounds.

entries.name: Ear Discharge (Otorrhea)
entries.definition: Abnormal fluid exuding from the ear canal.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, infection, or disruption of ear structures increases secretion or leakage.
management: Treat cause (antibiotics for infection, remove foreign body)
ENT referral if severe or persistent

entries.name: Fullness/Pressure in Ear
entries.definition: Sensation of blockage or pressure in the ear.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired ventilation or fluid accumulation in middle ear or canal.
management: Treat cause (decongestants, antibiotics for infection, remove wax)

entries.name: Depressed Mood
entries.definition: Persistent sadness, loss of interest.
entries.pathophysiology: Monoamine deficiency, stress, genetics.
entries.management: CBT, SSRIs/SNRIs, psychotherapy, treat cause, urgent care if suicidal.

entries.name: Mannerisms/Stereotypies
entries.definition: Repetitive, non-goal directed movements or behaviors.
entries.pathophysiology: Dysfunction in basal ganglia, cortical-subcortical circuits, dopamine imbalance.
entries.management: Treat cause, behavioral therapy, antipsychotics if indicated, occupational therapy, refer neurology/psychiatry if severe.

entries.name: Anxiety
entries.definition: Excessive worry, fear, or nervousness.
entries.pathophysiology: Amygdala hyperactivity, neurotransmitter imbalance.
entries.management: CBT, SSRIs/SNRIs, benzodiazepines (short-term), treat cause, psychotherapy.

entries.name: Psychosis
entries.definition: Loss of contact with reality (delusions, hallucinations).
entries.pathophysiology: Dopaminergic dysregulation, neurodevelopmental.
entries.management: Antipsychotics, treat cause, hospitalization if unsafe, psychotherapy, social support.

entries.name: Delirium
entries.definition: Acute fluctuating disturbance in attention and cognition.
entries.pathophysiology: Neurotransmitter imbalance, inflammation.
entries.management: Treat cause, supportive care, antipsychotics for agitation, reorientation, monitor safety.

entries.name: Aggression/Violence
entries.definition: Physical/verbal behavior intended to harm.
entries.pathophysiology: Frontal lobe, serotonergic, impulse control.
entries.management: Safety, treat cause, antipsychotics/benzodiazepines if needed, psychotherapy, legal/forensic referral.

entries.name: Suicidal Ideation/Behavior
entries.definition: Thoughts/acts of self-harm or suicide.
entries.pathophysiology: Mood dysregulation, hopelessness, impulsivity.
entries.management: Immediate safety, crisis intervention, treat underlying, hospitalization if high risk, psychotherapy.

entries.name: Obsessive Compulsive Symptoms
entries.definition: Intrusive thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors (compulsions).
entries.pathophysiology: Serotonergic/dopaminergic dysregulation.
entries.management: CBT (ERP), SSRIs, treat comorbidities, psychotherapy, psychiatry referral.

entries.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Symptoms
entries.definition: Re-experiencing, avoidance, hyperarousal after trauma.
entries.pathophysiology: Amygdala hyperactivity, HPA axis dysregulation.
entries.management: Trauma-focused CBT, SSRIs/SNRIs, EMDR, treat comorbidities, psychotherapy.

entries.name: Panic Attack
entries.definition: Sudden episode of intense fear/discomfort.
entries.pathophysiology: Catecholamine surge, amygdala activation.
entries.management: CBT, SSRIs/SNRIs, benzodiazepines (short-term), education, treat comorbidities.

entries.name: Paranoid Ideation
entries.definition: Suspiciousness, mistrust, or belief others intend harm.
entries.pathophysiology: Cognitive/perceptual distortion.
entries.management: Antipsychotics, psychotherapy, treat cause, safety planning, psychiatry referral.

entries.name: Hallucinations
entries.definition: Perception of sensory experience without external stimulus.
entries.pathophysiology: Sensory pathway dysfunction, neurotransmitter imbalance.
entries.management: Antipsychotics, treat cause, safety planning, hospitalization if unsafe, psychiatry referral.

entries.name: Catatonia
entries.definition: Marked psychomotor disturbance (stupor, mutism, posturing).
entries.pathophysiology: GABAergic/dopaminergic dysfunction.
entries.management: Lorazepam challenge, ECT if refractory, treat cause, supportive care, ICU if severe.

entries.name: Anhedonia
entries.definition: Inability to experience pleasure from activities usually found enjoyable.
entries.pathophysiology: Dysfunction in brain reward pathways, especially dopaminergic systems.
entries.management: Treat underlying cause, antidepressants, psychotherapy, refer psychiatry if severe or persistent.

entries.name: Phobias
entries.definition: Excessive, irrational fear of specific object, activity, or situation leading to avoidance.
entries.pathophysiology: Hyperactivation of amygdala and fear circuits in the brain.
characteristics: Panic symptoms when exposed to trigger
entries.management: Cognitive behavioral therapy, exposure therapy, SSRIs if severe, refer psychiatry if disabling.

entries.name: Obsessions
entries.definition: Recurrent, persistent, intrusive thoughts, urges, or images causing distress.
entries.pathophysiology: Dysfunction in cortico-striato-thalamo-cortical circuits, serotonin imbalance.
entries.management: SSRIs, CBT (exposure/response prevention), refer psychiatry if severe or with compulsions.

entries.name: Delusions
entries.definition: Fixed, false beliefs not amenable to reason or contrary evidence, outside cultural norms.
entries.pathophysiology: Dopaminergic and serotonergic dysregulation in cortical and subcortical brain regions.
characteristics: Paranoid, grandiose, somatic, or bizarre beliefs
entries.management: Treat cause, antipsychotics, safety precautions, psychiatric referral, hospitalize if risk present.

entries.name: Disorganized Speech
entries.definition: Speech that is incoherent, illogical, or difficult to follow.
entries.pathophysiology: Frontal lobe dysfunction, impaired thought organization, neurotransmitter imbalance.
entries.management: Treat cause, antipsychotics if psychosis, mood stabilizers for mania, supportive care, psychiatric referral.

entries.name: Disorganized Behavior
entries.definition: Behavior that is unpredictable, inappropriate, or lacks goal orientation.
entries.pathophysiology: Frontal lobe dysfunction, impaired executive function, neurotransmitter imbalance.
entries.management: Treat cause, antipsychotics, mood stabilizers, supportive care, safety measures, psychiatric referral.

entries.name: Mania
entries.definition: Abnormally elevated, expansive, or irritable mood with increased activity and impaired judgment.
entries.pathophysiology: Dysregulation of monoamines (dopamine, norepinephrine), frontal/limbic dysfunction.
entries.management: Mood stabilizers (lithium, valproate), antipsychotics, hospitalization if severe, psychiatric referral.

entries.name: Eosinophilia
entries.definition: Absolute increase in peripheral blood eosinophil count above normal (>0.5 × 10⁹/L in adults).
entries.pathophysiology: Expansion of eosinophil lineage in bone marrow due to cytokine stimulation (IL-5, GM-CSF); increased release into blood; tissue infiltration may cause organ dysfunction.
characteristics: Organ involvement: skin (pruritus, urticaria), lungs (cough, infiltrates), GI (pain, diarrhea), heart (myocarditis)
redFlags: Symptoms of organ involvement (chest pain, dyspnea, heart failure, neurologic deficits)
entries.management: Treat underlying cause; stop offending drugs; antiparasitic therapy if indicated; corticosteroids for severe/organ-threatening eosinophilia; cytoreductive therapy for Hypereosinophilic syndrome or malignancy; monitor for organ involvement; hospitalize if severe or red flags present.

entries.name: Recurrent Infections
entries.definition: Multiple episodes of infections over a short period or severe/unusual infections.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired immune response (cellular, humoral, phagocytic).
characteristics: Frequent, severe, or unusual infections (respiratory, GI, skin)
entries.management: Treat cause, antibiotics/antivirals, immunization, optimize nutrition, refer immunology/infectious disease.

entries.name: Failure to Thrive
entries.definition: Inadequate physical growth or inability to maintain expected development in infants/children or frailty in elderly.
entries.pathophysiology: Insufficient caloric intake/absorption, increased metabolic demand, chronic illness.
entries.management: Treat cause, nutritional rehabilitation, multidisciplinary team (dietitian, social work), monitor growth, hospitalize if severe or red flags.

entries.name: Chronic Diarrhea
entries.definition: Diarrhea lasting >4 weeks.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased secretion, decreased absorption, rapid transit, mucosal injury.
entries.management: Treat cause, rehydration, nutritional support, specific therapy (antibiotics, immunosuppression), refer gastroenterology if persistent.

entries.name: Persistent Thrush
entries.definition: Chronic or recurrent oral candidiasis.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired cell-mediated immunity allows fungal overgrowth.
entries.management: Treat cause, antifungal agents (nystatin, fluconazole), improve oral hygiene, nutrition support, refer if persistent.

entries.name: Recurrent Abscesses
entries.definition: Multiple episodes of localized pus collections in tissues.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired neutrophil function or immune response.
characteristics: May have scarring or sinus formation
entries.management: Incision/drainage, antibiotics, treat cause, immunology referral if recurrent, hygiene education.

entries.name: Persistent Lymphadenopathy
entries.definition: Lymph node enlargement >4 weeks, not resolving with standard therapy.
entries.pathophysiology: Immune activation, neoplastic infiltration, chronic inflammation.
redFlags: B symptoms (fever, night sweats, weight loss)
entries.management: Treat cause, biopsy if suspicious, monitor, refer hematology/oncology if red flags.

entries.name: Wheezing
entries.definition: High-pitched whistling sound during breathing, usually expiratory; chronic airway inflammation.
entries.pathophysiology: Airway narrowing, bronchospasm, mucus plugging, chronic inflammation.
entries.management: Inhaled bronchodilators, systemic steroids, oxygen, treat cause, epinephrine for anaphylaxis, airway support if needed.

entries.name: Angioedema
entries.definition: Localized, transient swelling of deeper dermis, subcutaneous tissue, or mucosa.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased vascular permeability mediated by histamine or bradykinin.
characteristics: Sudden swelling of lips, eyelids, tongue, larynx, GI tract
entries.management: Airway protection, epinephrine (if anaphylaxis), antihistamines, corticosteroids, C1-INH concentrate for hereditary, stop offending drug.

entries.name: Transfusion Reactions
entries.definition: Adverse response to transfused blood products.
entries.pathophysiology: Immune-mediated hemolysis, cytokine release, volume overload, allergic response.
entries.management: Stop transfusion, supportive care, fluids, treat shock, antihistamines, steroids, diuretics for TACO, notify transfusion service.

entries.name: Insect Sting Allergy
entries.definition: Hypersensitivity reaction to insect venom.
entries.pathophysiology: IgE-mediated mast cell degranulation, histamine release.
entries.management: Remove stinger, cold compress, antihistamines, epinephrine for anaphylaxis, steroids, airway management if severe.

entries.name: Oral Allergy Syndrome
entries.definition: Allergic symptoms in mouth/throat after eating certain raw fruits/vegetables.
etiologies: Cross-reactivity between pollen allergens and food proteins
entries.pathophysiology: IgE-mediated hypersensitivity, localized mast cell degranulation.
characteristics: Mild swelling of lips, mouth, throat
entries.management: Avoid triggers, antihistamines, epinephrine auto-injector if history of systemic symptoms, refer to allergy.

entries.name: Exercise-Induced Anaphylaxis
entries.definition: Anaphylaxis triggered by physical activity, sometimes with food cofactor.
entries.pathophysiology: Mast cell degranulation triggered by exercise (± food), histamine release.
entries.management: Immediate cessation of exercise, epinephrine, airway support, avoid triggers/cofactors, medical alert identification, refer to allergy.

entries.name: Cold Urticaria
entries.definition: Urticaria/angioedema triggered by cold exposure.
entries.pathophysiology: Mast cell degranulation after cold stimulus, histamine release.
entries.management: Avoid cold, antihistamines, epinephrine for severe/systemic, refer to allergy/immunology.

entries.name: Solar Urticaria
entries.definition: Urticaria induced by exposure to sunlight/UV radiation.
entries.pathophysiology: UV-induced mast cell degranulation, histamine release.
characteristics: Pruritic erythematous wheals on sun-exposed skin
entries.management: Sun avoidance, antihistamines, sunscreen, phototherapy (desensitization), epinephrine for severe/systemic.

entries.name: Cholinergic Urticaria
entries.definition: Urticaria triggered by heat, exercise, emotional stress.
entries.pathophysiology: Acetylcholine-induced mast cell degranulation, histamine release.
entries.management: Avoid triggers, antihistamines, cooling, epinephrine for severe/systemic, refer to allergy.

entries.name: Contact Urticaria
entries.definition: Urticaria at site of contact with allergen/irritant.
entries.pathophysiology: IgE-mediated or non-immunologic mast cell degranulation.
entries.management: Avoid triggers, antihistamines, topical steroids, epinephrine for systemic, refer to allergy.

entries.name: Eosinophilic Pneumonia
entries.definition: Pulmonary infiltrates with increased eosinophils in lung tissue or BAL.
entries.pathophysiology: Eosinophilic infiltration of alveoli/interstitium, immune-mediated inflammation.
entries.management: Stop offending drug, corticosteroids, treat underlying cause (antiparasitic), oxygen, supportive care, refer to pulmonology.

entries.name: Raynaud’s Phenomenon
entries.definition: Episodic vasospasm of the digits causing color changes (white-blue-red) on exposure to cold or stress.
etiologies: Secondary (systemic sclerosis, SLE, vascular disease, drugs)
entries.pathophysiology: Exaggerated vasoconstriction of digital arteries/arterioles.
entries.management: Avoid cold, smoking cessation, CCBs (nifedipine), treat underlying disease, vasodilators, refer if severe.

entries.name: Intermittent Claudication
entries.definition: Cramping pain in legs with exertion, relieved by rest.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced arterial blood flow to muscles during activity.
characteristics: May have skin changes, hair loss, ulcers
entries.management: Smoking cessation, exercise therapy, statins, antiplatelets, cilostazol, revascularization for severe cases.

entries.name: Rest Pain
entries.definition: Persistent pain in limbs at rest, usually due to critical limb ischemia.
entries.pathophysiology: Severe arterial narrowing/occlusion reduces perfusion, causing ischemic pain at rest.
characteristics: Burning, cramping, or tingling pain in feet/toes
Worse at night or with limb elevation
May have ulcers, gangrene, shiny skin
entries.management: Urgent revascularization, antiplatelets, statins, wound care, pain control, risk factor modification.

entries.name: Non-Healing Ulcers
entries.definition: Ulcers that fail to heal after 4–6 weeks of appropriate care.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired perfusion, neuropathy, or venous stasis impedes healing.
characteristics: May have necrosis, infection, surrounding erythema
entries.management: Treat cause, optimize perfusion, wound care, antibiotics if infected, surgical intervention if severe.

entries.name: Coldness in Extremities
entries.definition: Abnormal sensation or objective finding of cool extremities, often due to reduced blood flow or vasoconstriction.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased perfusion to peripheral tissues from vascular obstruction, low cardiac output, or vasoconstriction.
characteristics: May be associated with numbness or pain
redFlags: Sudden onset with pain and pallor (acute limb ischemia)
entries.management: Treat underlying cause: revascularization, warming, fluids/vasopressors, thyroid replacement, stop offending drugs.

entries.name: Color Changes
entries.definition: Alteration in skin color of extremities (pallor, cyanosis, rubor, livedo).
entries.pathophysiology: Changes in blood flow or oxygenation to skin.
entries.management: Avoid triggers, treat cause, vasodilators for Raynaud, revascularization for PAD, immunosuppression for vasculitis.

entries.name: Weak/Absent Pulses
entries.definition: Diminished or non-palpable arterial pulses in extremities.
entries.pathophysiology: Arterial obstruction or severe vasoconstriction reduces pulse amplitude.
characteristics: May have pain, numbness, weakness, ulceration, gangrene
entries.management: Urgent revascularization for acute ischemia, treat underlying cause, monitor for compartment syndrome.

entries.name: Gangrene
entries.definition: Death of tissue due to inadequate blood supply, infection, or trauma.
entries.pathophysiology: Ischemia leads to tissue necrosis, may be dry (ischemic) or wet (infected).
characteristics: May have swelling, pain, fever, systemic toxicity
entries.management: Surgical debridement/amputation, antibiotics, revascularization, glycemic control, critical care if sepsis.

entries.name: Swelling/Edema
entries.definition: Abnormal enlargement of body part due to fluid accumulation, inflammation, or mass.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased hydrostatic pressure, low oncotic pressure, capillary leak, lymphatic obstruction.
entries.management: Treat cause, diuretics if indicated, restrict salt/fluid, compression, anticoagulation for DVT, hospitalize if severe.

entries.name: Varicose Veins
entries.definition: Dilated, tortuous superficial veins, usually in lower limbs.
entries.pathophysiology: Venous valve incompetence leads to increased venous pressure and dilation.
entries.management: Compression stockings, leg elevation, sclerotherapy, surgery for severe cases, treat complications.

entries.name: Ulcers/Gangrene
entries.definition: Chronic open wounds or tissue necrosis, often due to vascular insufficiency.
entries.pathophysiology: Ischemia or stasis impairs healing, leading to ulceration/gangrene.
entries.management: Treat cause, wound care, antibiotics, surgical intervention, glycemic control, vascular referral.

entries.name: Halitosis (Oral Malodor)
entries.definition: Offensive breath odor.
entries.pathophysiology: Bacterial overgrowth, volatile sulfur compounds.
entries.management: Oral hygiene, treat cause, dental care, hydration, dental/ENT referral if persistent.

entries.name: Tooth Mobility
entries.definition: Abnormal movement of tooth in socket.
entries.pathophysiology: Loss of periodontal support.
entries.management: Treat cause, splinting, periodontal therapy, extraction if severe.

entries.name: Tooth Discoloration
entries.definition: Abnormal color of teeth.
entries.pathophysiology: Deposition of pigments or altered enamel/dentin.
entries.management: Cleaning, whitening, veneers/crowns if severe, treat cause, dental referral.

entries.name: Toothache
entries.definition: Pain in or around a tooth.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation or infection of dental pulp or surrounding tissues.
entries.management: Treat cause, analgesia, antibiotics if infection, dental restoration or extraction, urgent referral if spreading infection.

entries.name: Tooth Sensitivity
entries.definition: Discomfort or pain in teeth in response to stimuli (thermal, chemical, tactile).
entries.pathophysiology: Exposed dentin or nerve endings increase sensitivity.
characteristics: Sharp, transient pain with cold, hot, sweet, or touch
entries.management: Desensitizing toothpaste, fluoride, treat underlying cause, dental restoration if needed, avoid triggers.

entries.name: Swollen Gums
entries.definition: Enlargement or puffiness of the gingival tissue.
entries.pathophysiology: Inflammation, edema, or infiltration of gingiva.
entries.management: Oral hygiene, treat infection, remove offending drugs, dental cleaning, treat underlying disease, urgent referral if systemic.

entries.name: Gum Bleeding
entries.definition: Bleeding from the gums, spontaneous or provoked (e.g., brushing).
entries.pathophysiology: Fragile or inflamed gingiva, impaired hemostasis.
entries.management: Oral hygiene, treat underlying cause, dental cleaning, vitamin C replacement, hematology referral if systemic.

entries.name: Gum Recession
entries.definition: Retraction of gum margin exposing tooth root.
entries.pathophysiology: Loss of gingival attachment exposes root surface.
entries.management: Oral hygiene, gentle brushing, treat periodontitis, surgical grafting if severe, dental referral.

entries.name: Loose Teeth
entries.definition: Mobility of teeth in their sockets.
entries.pathophysiology: Loss of periodontal ligament or bone support.
entries.management: Treat cause, splinting, treat infection, extraction if non-restorable, dental referral, manage systemic disease.

entries.name: Tooth Erosion
entries.definition: Loss of tooth structure by chemical (non-bacterial) processes.
entries.pathophysiology: Acid demineralization of enamel/dentin.
entries.management: Dietary modification, fluoride, treat underlying cause, dental restoration, referral for eating disorder if present.

entries.name: Vaginal Bleeding
entries.definition: Any bleeding from the vagina during pregnancy, ranging from spotting to heavy flow.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of uterine, placental, or cervical vessels.
entries.management: Stabilize, IV fluids, monitor vitals, urgent OB referral, Rh immunoglobulin if Rh-, treat cause (surgical or medical).

entries.name: Abdominal Pain
entries.definition: Pain localized to the abdomen in pregnancy.
entries.pathophysiology: Uterine, placental, or extrauterine pathology; stretching or inflammation.
characteristics: Associated with bleeding, contractions, GI/urinary symptoms
entries.management: Treat cause, monitor mother/fetus, analgesia, surgical/OB intervention if indicated.

entries.name: Decreased Fetal Movement
entries.definition: Reduction or cessation of perceived fetal activity.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired fetal oxygenation or neurological function.
entries.management: Urgent fetal assessment, admit if non-reassuring, treat cause, possible delivery if fetal compromise.

entries.name: Severe Headache
entries.definition: Intense or persistent head pain during pregnancy.
entries.pathophysiology: Vascular, hypertensive, or inflammatory mechanisms.
characteristics: May have visual changes, photophobia, nausea
entries.management: BP control, magnesium sulfate if preeclampsia, analgesia, treat cause, urgent OB/neuro referral if red flags.

entries.name: Visual Changes
entries.definition: Altered vision (blurred, loss, spots, photophobia) during pregnancy.
entries.pathophysiology: Retinal or CNS vascular changes, edema, or ischemia.
entries.management: BP control, magnesium sulfate if preeclampsia, treat cause, urgent OB/ophthalmology referral if severe.

entries.name: Swelling / Edema
entries.definition: Accumulation of fluid in tissues, leading to swelling, in pregnancy.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased capillary permeability, sodium/water retention, decreased oncotic pressure.
entries.management: Treat cause, monitor BP/proteinuria, diuretics if indicated, anticoagulation for DVT, urgent referral if preeclampsia.

entries.name: Intense Itching
entries.definition: Severe pruritus during pregnancy, often without rash.
entries.pathophysiology: Bile acid accumulation, histamine/cytokine release.
entries.management: Treat cause, ursodeoxycholic acid for cholestasis, antihistamines, monitor fetus, consider early delivery if severe.

entries.name: Vomiting
entries.definition: Nausea, vomiting during pregnancy.
entries.pathophysiology: Hormonal changes, GI infection, metabolic disturbance.
entries.management: IV fluids, antiemetics, correct electrolytes, treat cause, admit if unable to tolerate PO or severe dehydration.

entries.name: Diarrhea
entries.definition: Diarrhea during pregnancy.
entries.pathophysiology: Hormonal changes, GI infection, metabolic disturbance.
entries.management: IV fluids, antiemetics, correct electrolytes, treat cause, admit if unable to tolerate PO or severe dehydration.

entries.name: Dysuria
entries.definition: Dysuria, or discomfort/burning on urination during pregnancy.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal inflammation or infection of urinary tract.
entries.management: Antibiotics safe in pregnancy, fluids, analgesia, admit if pyelonephritis or sepsis, monitor for preterm labor.

entries.name: Failure to Thrive
entries.definition: Poor weight gain/growth in infants/children.
entries.pathophysiology: Inadequate intake, absorption, or utilization.
entries.management: Nutritional rehab, treat cause, social support, multidisciplinary team, hospitalize if severe.

entries.name: Sickle Cell Crisis (Pediatric)
entries.definition: Acute vaso-occlusive episode in child with sickle cell.
entries.pathophysiology: Sickled RBCs occlude vessels, ischemia.
entries.management: Analgesia, hydration, oxygen, antibiotics if infection, transfusion if severe, hematology referral.

entries.name: Neonatal Jaundice
entries.definition: Yellowing of skin/eyes in newborn.
entries.pathophysiology: Unconjugated/conjugated hyperbilirubinemia.
entries.management: Phototherapy, treat cause, exchange transfusion if severe, monitor neurodevelopment.

entries.name: Fever
entries.definition: Elevated body temperature above normal in a child.
entries.pathophysiology: Pyrogen-mediated hypothalamic reset of temperature set point.
entries.management: Treat cause, antipyretics, fluids, hospitalize if unstable or red flags.

entries.name: Poor Feeding
entries.definition: Inadequate intake of breast milk or formula relative to needs.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired suck/swallow, increased metabolic demand, feeding fatigue.
entries.management: Treat cause, nutritional support, IV fluids if dehydrated, hospitalize if severe.

entries.name: Lethargy
entries.definition: State of abnormal drowsiness, sluggishness, or lack of energy/alertness.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired CNS arousal due to metabolic, structural, toxic, or infectious causes.
redFlags: Associated with fever, confusion, focal deficit, shock
entries.management: Treat cause, airway protection if needed, fluids, correct metabolic derangements, hospitalize if severe or unclear etiology.

entries.name: Polyuria
entries.definition: Excessive urine output.
entries.pathophysiology: Osmotic diuresis, ADH dysfunction, renal concentrating defect.
entries.management: Treat cause, fluid/electrolyte management, endocrinology referral if needed.

entries.name: Polydipsia
entries.definition: Excessive thirst.
entries.pathophysiology: ADH dysfunction, renal concentrating defect.
entries.management: Treat cause, fluid/electrolyte management, endocrinology referral if needed.

entries.name: Irritability
entries.definition: Excessive fussiness, crying, or inability to be consoled.
entries.pathophysiology: Discomfort or CNS irritability due to underlying illness or needs.
entries.management: Treat cause, comfort measures, fluids, hospitalize if red flags or unclear etiology.

entries.name: Unusual Bleeding/Bruising
entries.definition: Bleeding or bruising out of proportion to trauma or spontaneously.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired hemostasis due to platelet or coagulation factor deficiency/dysfunction.
entries.management: Treat cause, transfuse as indicated, vitamin K, hematology referral, hospitalize if severe or unclear.

entries.name: Failure to Thrive
entries.definition: Poor weight gain/growth in infants/children.
entries.pathophysiology: Inadequate intake, absorption, or utilization.
entries.management: Nutritional rehab, treat cause, social support, multidisciplinary team, hospitalize if severe.

entries.name: Sickle Cell Crisis (Pediatric)
entries.definition: Acute vaso-occlusive episode in child with sickle cell.
entries.pathophysiology: Sickled RBCs occlude vessels, ischemia.
entries.management: Analgesia, hydration, oxygen, antibiotics if infection, transfusion if severe, hematology referral.

entries.name: Neonatal Jaundice
entries.definition: Yellowing of skin/eyes in newborn.
entries.pathophysiology: Unconjugated/conjugated hyperbilirubinemia.
entries.management: Phototherapy, treat cause, exchange transfusion if severe, monitor neurodevelopment.

entries.name: Fever
entries.definition: Elevated body temperature above normal in a child.
entries.pathophysiology: Pyrogen-mediated hypothalamic reset of temperature set point.
entries.management: Treat cause, antipyretics, fluids, hospitalize if unstable or red flags.

entries.name: Poor Feeding
entries.definition: Inadequate intake of breast milk or formula relative to needs.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired suck/swallow, increased metabolic demand, feeding fatigue.
entries.management: Treat cause, nutritional support, IV fluids if dehydrated, hospitalize if severe.

entries.name: Lethargy
entries.definition: State of abnormal drowsiness, sluggishness, or lack of energy/alertness.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired CNS arousal due to metabolic, structural, toxic, or infectious causes.
redFlags: Associated with fever, confusion, focal deficit, shock
entries.management: Treat cause, airway protection if needed, fluids, correct metabolic derangements, hospitalize if severe or unclear etiology.

entries.name: Polyuria
entries.definition: Excessive urine output.
entries.pathophysiology: Osmotic diuresis, ADH dysfunction, renal concentrating defect.
entries.management: Treat cause, fluid/electrolyte management, endocrinology referral if needed.

entries.name: Polydipsia
entries.definition: Excessive thirst.
entries.pathophysiology: ADH dysfunction, renal concentrating defect.
entries.management: Treat cause, fluid/electrolyte management, endocrinology referral if needed.

entries.name: Irritability
entries.definition: Excessive fussiness, crying, or inability to be consoled.
entries.pathophysiology: Discomfort or CNS irritability due to underlying illness or needs.
entries.management: Treat cause, comfort measures, fluids, hospitalize if red flags or unclear etiology.

entries.name: Unusual Bleeding/Bruising
entries.definition: Bleeding or bruising out of proportion to trauma or spontaneously.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired hemostasis due to platelet or coagulation factor deficiency/dysfunction.
entries.management: Treat cause, transfuse as indicated, vitamin K, hematology referral, hospitalize if severe or unclear.

entries.name: Frailty
entries.definition: State of increased vulnerability to stressors.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced physiologic reserve, sarcopenia.
entries.management: Exercise, nutrition, treat underlying, fall prevention, multidisciplinary care.

entries.name: Falls
entries.definition: Unintentional descent to ground/floor.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired balance, muscle weakness.
entries.management: Address risk factors, PT/OT, home safety, vision correction, medication review.

entries.name: Polypharmacy
entries.definition: Use of ≥5 medications or inappropriate meds.
entries.pathophysiology: Drug-drug interactions, adverse effects.
entries.management: Deprescribing, medication reconciliation, review for appropriateness, monitor for ADRs.

entries.name: Urinary Incontinence
entries.definition: Involuntary leakage of urine.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired bladder control.
entries.management: Bladder training, pelvic floor exercises, treat cause, medications, surgery if refractory.

entries.name: Pressure Ulcers
entries.definition: Localized injury to skin/tissue over bony prominence.
entries.pathophysiology: Ischemia, tissue necrosis.
entries.management: Pressure relief, wound care, nutrition, treat infection, surgery if severe.

entries.name: Malnutrition (Elderly)
entries.definition: Deficiency of nutrients in older adults.
entries.pathophysiology: Inadequate intake/absorption/utilization.
entries.management: Nutritional support, treat cause, supplements, social support, monitor weight.

entries.name: Hearing Impairment
entries.definition: Loss of hearing in older adults.
entries.pathophysiology: Degeneration of sensory organs or neural pathways.
entries.management: Corrective devices, hearing aids, treat cause, rehabilitation, social support.

entries.name: Vision Impairment
entries.definition: Loss of vision in older adults.
entries.pathophysiology: Degeneration of sensory organs or neural pathways.
entries.management: Corrective devices, surgery (cataract), treat cause, rehabilitation, social support.

entries.name: Gait Disturbance
entries.definition: Impaired walking or balance in elderly.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired motor, sensory, or musculoskeletal function.
entries.management: Physical therapy, assistive devices, treat cause, fall prevention, medication review.

entries.name: Sarcopenia
entries.definition: Loss of muscle mass and strength with aging.
entries.pathophysiology: Muscle atrophy, reduced protein synthesis.
entries.management: Resistance exercise, protein supplementation, treat underlying, vitamin D, rehabilitation.

entries.name: Erectile Dysfunction
entries.definition: Persistent inability to achieve/maintain erection.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired blood flow, nerve, or hormone.
entries.management: Lifestyle, PDE5 inhibitors, treat cause, psych support, endocrinology/urology referral.

entries.name: Premature Ejaculation
entries.definition: Ejaculation with minimal stimulation before desired.
entries.pathophysiology: Altered serotonin, anxiety.
entries.management: Behavioral therapy, SSRIs, topical anesthetics, treat comorbidities, psychosexual counseling.

entries.name: Delayed Ejaculation
entries.definition: Marked delay or absence of ejaculation.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired neural/hormonal pathways.
entries.management: Treat cause, adjust meds, psychotherapy, sexual counseling, endocrinology/urology referral.

entries.name: Female Sexual Interest/Arousal Disorder
entries.definition: Lack/reduced sexual interest/arousal in women.
entries.pathophysiology: Hypoactive sexual desire, impaired arousal.
entries.management: Psychosexual therapy, treat cause, hormone therapy if indicated, adjust meds, couples therapy.

entries.name: Female Orgasmic Disorder
entries.definition: Delay/infrequency/absence of orgasm in women.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired sexual response cycle.
entries.management: Psychosexual therapy, treat cause, adjust meds, education, couples therapy.

entries.name: Genito-Pelvic Pain/Penetration Disorder
entries.definition: Pain, fear, or difficulty with vaginal penetration.
entries.pathophysiology: Pelvic floor spasm, mucosal pain.
entries.management: Pelvic floor therapy, psychosexual therapy, treat infection, topical therapies, multidisciplinary care.

entries.name: Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder (Men)
entries.definition: Persistently low/no sexual desire in men.
entries.pathophysiology: Low testosterone, depression, stress.
entries.management: Treat cause, testosterone therapy if indicated, psychotherapy, adjust meds, couples therapy.

entries.name: Sexual Aversion Disorder
entries.definition: Persistent avoidance of sexual contact.
entries.pathophysiology: Anxiety/aversion to sexual activity.
entries.management: Psychotherapy, trauma-focused therapy, couples therapy, treat comorbidities.

entries.name: Decreased Libido
entries.definition: Reduced interest or desire for sexual activity.
entries.pathophysiology: Altered sex hormone levels, psychological and physical changes affecting sexual drive.
entries.management: Treat underlying cause, counseling, support, address relationship issues, refer if persistent or severe.

entries.name: Painful Intercourse (Dyspareunia)
entries.definition: Pain during or after vaginal penetration.
entries.pathophysiology: Mucosal dryness, inflammation, pelvic floor muscle tension, hormonal changes.
characteristics: Superficial or deep pain with intercourse
entries.management: Treat cause, lubricants, pelvic floor therapy, treat infection, psychological support, refer gynecology if persistent.

entries.name: Orgasmic Dysfunction Female
entries.definition: Difficulty achieving orgasm or reduced orgasmic sensation.
entries.pathophysiology: Altered sexual response cycle due to hormonal and psychological factors.
characteristics: Delayed, absent, or reduced intensity of orgasm
entries.management: Counseling, sex therapy, treat underlying cause, medication adjustment, refer if persistent.

entries.name: Orgasmic Dysfunction Male
entries.definition: Difficulty achieving orgasm or reduced orgasmic sensation.
entries.pathophysiology: Altered sexual response cycle due to hormonal and psychological factors.
characteristics: Delayed, absent, or reduced intensity of orgasm
entries.management: Counseling, sex therapy, treat underlying cause, medication adjustment, refer if persistent.

entries.name: Vaginal Dryness
entries.definition: Reduced vaginal lubrication causing discomfort, especially during intercourse.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased estrogen levels or mucosal blood flow, altered vaginal flora.
entries.management: Lubricants, treat infection, address hydration, estrogen therapy if indicated (postpartum), refer if persistent.

entries.name: Bleeding After Sex
entries.definition: Vaginal bleeding occurring after sexual intercourse.
entries.pathophysiology: Fragile or inflamed cervical/vaginal tissue, vascular lesions, placental abnormalities.
characteristics: May be painless or associated with pain
entries.management: Treat cause, pelvic rest, treat infection, remove polyp if needed, urgent OB referral if heavy or persistent bleeding.

entries.name: Infertility (Female)
entries.definition: Failure to achieve pregnancy after 12 months of unprotected intercourse.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of normal reproductive processes (ovulation, fertilization, implantation).
entries.management: Treat cause, ovulation induction, ART (IVF), surgery for tubal/uterine, lifestyle, refer to fertility specialist.

entries.name: Infertility (Male)
entries.definition: Failure to achieve pregnancy after 12 months of unprotected intercourse.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of normal reproductive processes (ovulation, fertilization, implantation).
entries.management: Treat cause, ART (IVF), lifestyle, refer to fertility specialist.

entries.name: Anovulation
entries.definition: Absence of ovulation in reproductive-age women.
entries.pathophysiology: Disrupted HPO axis, hormonal imbalance.
investigations: Hormonal profile (FSH, LH, PRL, TSH, estradiol, androgens)
entries.management: Treat cause, weight loss, ovulation induction (clomiphene/letrozole), metformin (PCOS), hormone therapy, refer if persistent.

entries.name: Hirsutism
entries.definition: Excess terminal hair growth in women in a male pattern.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased androgen production or sensitivity.
characteristics: Coarse hair on face, chest, abdomen
entries.management: Treat cause, weight loss, OCPs, anti-androgens (spironolactone), cosmetic removal, refer if rapid/virilization.

entries.name: Reduced Lubrication
entries.definition: Insufficient vaginal lubrication during sexual activity.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased estrogen or impaired arousal reduces mucosal secretions.
entries.management: Lubricants, topical estrogen, treat cause, sexual counseling, refer if persistent.

entries.name: Substance Use (Alcohol, Tobacco, Drugs)
entries.definition: Use of substances impacting health/function.
entries.pathophysiology: Neurochemical reward, dependence, toxicity.
entries.management: Brief intervention, counseling, pharmacotherapy, harm reduction, addiction referral.

entries.name: Occupational Lung Disease
entries.definition: Measures to prevent work related respiratory illness.
entries.pathophysiology: Inhalation injury, chronic inflammation, fibrosis.
entries.management: PPE, exposure control, surveillance, smoking cessation, early detection.

entries.name: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss
entries.definition: Sensorineural hearing loss from chronic loud noise exposure.
entries.pathophysiology: Hair cell damage in cochlea.
entries.management: Hearing protection, noise avoidance, hearing aids, workplace regulation.

entries.name: Post-Vaccination Fever
entries.definition: Elevated body temperature after vaccination.
etiologies: Immune response to vaccine antigens or adjuvants
entries.pathophysiology: Cytokine-mediated hypothalamic set-point elevation.
entries.management: Reassure, antipyretics, fluids, monitor, hospitalize if red flags.

entries.name: Post-Vaccination Rash
entries.definition: Rash occurring after immunization.
entries.pathophysiology: Hypersensitivity or immune complex deposition.
entries.management: Reassure, antihistamines, topical steroids, treat anaphylaxis if present, report as adverse event.

entries.name: Occupational Exposure
entries.definition: Contact with hazardous agents at work.
entries.pathophysiology: Direct tissue injury, immune response, carcinogenesis, infection.
characteristics: Asymptomatic or acute symptoms (rash, cough, burns, infection)
entries.management: Remove from exposure, decontaminate, treat acute effects, report to occupational health, monitor for chronic disease.

entries.name: Environmental Exposure
entries.definition: Contact with harmful agents in the environment.
entries.pathophysiology: Direct toxicity, immune activation, carcinogenesis, infection.
characteristics: Acute: cough, dyspnea, rash, GI upset
entries.management: Remove from exposure, supportive care, treat cause, public health notification if needed.

entries.name: Family History of Disease
entries.definition: Presence of disease in first degree relatives.
entries.pathophysiology: Inherited gene mutations, epigenetic, environmental.
characteristics: May prompt screening or risk stratification
redFlags: Early-onset disease in multiple family members
entries.management: Enhanced screening, lifestyle modification, genetic counseling, preventive interventions.

entries.name: High-Risk Sexual Behavior
entries.definition: Sexual practices increasing risk for STIs/HIV.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased exposure to pathogens.
entries.management: Counseling, barrier protection, PrEP/PEP, regular screening, vaccination (HPV, HBV), treat detected infections.

entries.name: Smoking Use
entries.definition: Current or past use of tobacco products.
entries.pathophysiology: Nicotine dependence, carcinogenesis, vascular injury.
entries.management: Smoking cessation, counseling, pharmacotherapy (NRT, varenicline), screen for complications.

entries.name: Physical Inactivity
entries.definition: Insufficient physical activity to meet health guidelines.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced fitness, muscle atrophy, metabolic changes.
entries.management: Exercise prescription, PT/OT, motivational support, address barriers.

entries.name: Sedentary Behavior Syndrome
entries.definition: Prolonged sitting/low physical activity leading to adverse health outcomes.
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced energy expenditure, metabolic dysregulation.
entries.management: Behavioral counseling, scheduled activity breaks, exercise prescription, workplace modification.

entries.name: Unhealthy Diet / Diet Related Cardiometabolic Risk
entries.definition: Increased risk of CVD, diabetes, metabolic syndrome due to poor diet.
entries.pathophysiology: Insulin resistance, dyslipidemia, inflammation.
entries.management: Mediterranean diet, nutrition counseling, weight loss, screen/monitor risk factors.

entries.name: Disordered Eating (Anorexia/Bulimia)
entries.definition: Disturbed eating behaviors with weight/shape preoccupation.
entries.pathophysiology: Dysregulated appetite, body image distortion.
entries.management: Multidisciplinary (CBT, nutrition, medical), monitor labs, treat comorbidities, admit if unstable.

entries.name: Intermittent Fasting Protocols
entries.definition: Structured eating patterns alternating fasting/feeding for health.
entries.pathophysiology: Ketosis, improved insulin sensitivity, reduced inflammation.
entries.management: Medical supervision, nutrition education, monitor for adverse effects, adjust as needed.

entries.name: Processed Food Dependence
entries.definition: Compulsive consumption of processed foods despite harm.
entries.pathophysiology: Dopamine-mediated reward, poor satiety, cravings.
entries.management: Behavioral therapy, nutrition counseling, support groups, address triggers.

entries.name: Sleep Apnea Symptoms
entries.definition: Repeated episodes of upper airway obstruction during sleep.
entries.pathophysiology: Pharyngeal collapse, hypoxia, arousal from sleep.
entries.management: Weight loss, CPAP, positional therapy, surgery (UPPP), treat comorbidities.

entries.name: Emotional Eating
entries.definition: Disturbed eating behaviors with weight/shape preoccupation.
entries.pathophysiology: Dysregulated appetite, body image distortion.
entries.management: Multidisciplinary (CBT, nutrition, medical), monitor labs, treat comorbidities, admit if unstable.

entries.name: Social Isolation
entries.definition: Lack of social connections/support leading to adverse health outcomes.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased stress, depression, poor health behaviors, immune dysfunction.
entries.management: Social engagement, community resources, therapy, address barriers.

entries.name: Sexual Health Dissatisfaction
entries.definition: Persistent dissatisfaction with sexual health/function.
entries.pathophysiology: Impaired intimacy, low libido, anxiety, depression.
entries.management: Sex therapy, couples therapy, treat medical/psych causes, education.

entries.name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction
entries.definition: Impaired mitochondrial energy production affecting cellular metabolism.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased ATP, increased ROS, impaired cell signaling.
entries.management: Exercise, mitochondrial nutrients (CoQ10, B vitamins), antioxidants, treat underlying disease.

entries.name: Inflammaging
