entries.definition: Chronic, low-grade systemic inflammation associated with aging.
entries.pathophysiology: Pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-6, TNF α) drive tissue damage and aging.
entries.management: Anti-inflammatory diet, exercise, manage comorbidities, statins/metformin (selected), monitor inflammation.

entries.name: Hormonal Decline Women
entries.definition: Age-related reduction in sex hormones (Estrogen / Progesterone).
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced hormone synthesis, altered feedback, tissue sensitivity loss.
entries.management: HRT (individualized), lifestyle, bone protection, manage comorbidities, regular monitoring.

entries.name: Hormonal Decline Men
entries.definition: Age-related reduction in sex hormones (Testosterone).
entries.pathophysiology: Reduced hormone synthesis, altered feedback, tissue sensitivity loss.
entries.management: HRT (individualized), lifestyle, bone protection, manage comorbidities, regular monitoring.

entries.name: Cognitive Decline Risk
entries.definition: Increased risk of progressive loss of cognitive function.
entries.pathophysiology: Neuronal loss, synaptic dysfunction, amyloid/tau pathology.
entries.management: Cognitive training, exercise, risk factor control, treat reversible, social engagement.

entries.name: Skin Photoaging
entries.definition: Premature skin aging due to chronic UV exposure.
entries.pathophysiology: DNA damage, collagen breakdown, elastosis.
entries.management: Sun protection, topical retinoids, antioxidants, cosmetic procedures, monitor lesions.

entries.name: Glycation End-Product Accumulation
entries.definition: Build-up of advanced glycation end products (AGEs) in tissues.
entries.pathophysiology: Protein cross-linking, tissue stiffness, inflammation.
entries.management: Glycemic control, low-AGE diet, antioxidants, exercise, treat comorbidities.

entries.name: Oxidative Stress Overload
entries.definition: Excessive ROS production overwhelming antioxidant defenses.
entries.pathophysiology: ROS damage DNA, proteins, lipids, accelerates aging.
entries.management: Antioxidant-rich diet, exercise, avoid toxins, supplement (C/E, NAC), treat cause.

entries.name: Epigenetic Aging Acceleration
entries.definition: Faster progression of biological age vs. chronological age by epigenetic clocks.
entries.pathophysiology: DNA methylation changes, altered gene expression.
entries.management: Lifestyle optimization, stress reduction, exercise, caloric restriction, monitor biological age.

entries.name: Arterial Stiffness
entries.definition: Loss of arterial elasticity, increasing CV risk.
entries.pathophysiology: Collagen cross linking, elastin degradation, vascular calcification.
entries.management: BP control, statins, exercise, diet, manage risk factors, monitor CV health.

entries.name: Wrinkles and Fine Lines
entries.definition: Visible lines, creases, or furrows in the skin, especially on the face, due to loss of skin elasticity and collagen.
entries.pathophysiology: Decreased collagen/elastin, reduced dermal thickness, loss of moisture, UV-induced DNA damage.
characteristics: Fine or deep lines, most prominent on forehead, periorbital, perioral, and neck areas. Severity scales (e.g., Glogau).
redFlags: Associated with systemic symptoms (e.g., weight loss, fatigue)
entries.management: Sun protection, topical retinoids, antioxidants, moisturizers, botulinum toxin, fillers, laser resurfacing, chemical peels, lifestyle modification.

entries.name: Face Volume Loss
entries.definition: Loss of subcutaneous fat and soft tissue leading to hollowing of cheeks, temples, or periorbital regions.
entries.pathophysiology: Adipose tissue atrophy, bone resorption, decreased collagen, redistribution of facial fat pads.
entries.management: Dermal fillers, autologous fat transfer, facial implants, treat underlying disease, nutritional support.

entries.name: Sagging Skin
entries.definition: Laxity or drooping of skin due to loss of elasticity, collagen, and supporting structures.
entries.pathophysiology: Degradation of collagen/elastin, reduced dermal support, fat pad descent, gravity effects.
investigations: Rarely biopsy (if connective tissue disorder suspected)
entries.management: Skin tightening procedures (radiofrequency, ultrasound), surgical lifting, fillers, topical retinoids, treat underlying cause.

entries.name: Uneven Skin Tone & Texture
entries.definition: Irregular pigmentation and/or surface roughness of the skin.
entries.pathophysiology: Melanin overproduction, abnormal keratinization, collagen breakdown, UV induced injury.
entries.management: Sun protection, topical depigmenting agents (hydroquinone, azelaic acid), retinoids, chemical peels, laser therapy, treat underlying cause.

entries.name: Acne and Acne Scars
entries.definition: Inflammatory and non inflammatory lesions of pilosebaceous units; scars are permanent textural changes post inflammation.
entries.pathophysiology: Follicular hyperkeratinization, increased sebum, bacterial colonization, inflammation, dermal remodeling (scarring).
entries.management: Topical retinoids, benzoyl peroxide, antibiotics, hormonal therapy, isotretinoin, scar treatments (microneedling, laser, subcision, fillers).

entries.name: Redness
entries.definition: Persistent or episodic erythema of the facial skin.
entries.pathophysiology: Vasodilation, neurovascular dysregulation, inflammation, increased blood flow.
redFlags: Associated with fever, swelling, pain, systemic illness
entries.management: Avoid triggers, topical metronidazole/azelaic acid, oral tetracyclines, laser for telangiectasia, treat underlying cause.

entries.name: Nose Shape
entries.definition: Abnormal or undesired contour, Size, or symmetry of the nose.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of bone/cartilage growth, trauma, surgical alteration, tissue loss.
entries.management: Surgical correction (rhinoplasty, septoplasty), fillers (minor), treat infection/trauma, psychological support.

entries.name: Ear Appearance
entries.definition: Unusual or undesired shape, Size, or position of the auricle.
entries.pathophysiology: Abnormal cartilage development, trauma, scar formation, tissue loss.
entries.management: Surgical correction (otoplasty), keloid management, treat infection/hematoma, psychological support.

entries.name: Tired Eyes
entries.definition: Appearance of fatigue around the eyes, including dark circles, puffiness, or drooping eyelids.
entries.pathophysiology: Thinning of periorbital skin, fat herniation, vascular congestion, fluid retention.
entries.management: Sleep hygiene, topical agents (caffeine, retinoids), fillers, blepharoplasty, treat underlying cause.

entries.name: Unwanted Facial Hair
entries.definition: Excess terminal hair growth in a male-pattern distribution on a female face (hirsutism) or undesired hair in any gender.
entries.pathophysiology: Androgen excess or sensitivity, increased follicular activity.
characteristics: Coarse, pigmented hair on upper lip, chin, jawline, cheeks
May be associated with acne, irregular menses
entries.management: Hair removal (laser, electrolysis), anti-androgens (spironolactone), oral contraceptives, treat underlying cause.

entries.name: Galactorrhea
entries.definition: Non-puerperal, inappropriate lactation from the breast.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased prolactin production or stimulation of breast tissue.
entries.management: Treat cause, dopamine agonists, surgery/radiation for macroadenoma, stop offending drugs, refer endocrinology.

entries.name: Early Puberty (Girls)
entries.definition: Onset of secondary sexual characteristics before age 8 for girls.
entries.pathophysiology: Early activation of hypothalamic-pituitary gonadal axis.
entries.management: Treat cause, hormone therapy if indicated, endocrinology referral, monitor growth/development.

entries.name: Late Puberty (Girls)
entries.definition: Delayed beyond age 13 for girls.
entries.pathophysiology: Delayed activation of hypothalamic-pituitary gonadal axis.
entries.management: Treat cause, hormone therapy if indicated, endocrinology referral, monitor growth/development.

entries.name: Female Breast Small
entries.definition: Breast Size below patient’s expectation or age-related norm.
entries.pathophysiology: Underdevelopment of breast tissue (mammary hypoplasia), low estrogen.
entries.management: Reassurance, augmentation (implants, fat grafting), treat underlying hormonal disorder, psychological support.

entries.name: Female Breast Too Large
entries.definition: Excessive breast tissue causing discomfort or functional impairment.
entries.pathophysiology: Hypertrophy of glandular and adipose tissue.
entries.management: Supportive bras, weight loss, reduction mammoplasty, treat underlying cause, analgesia for pain.

entries.name: Female Breast Sagging
entries.definition: Descent of breast tissue and nipple below the inframammary fold (ptosis).
entries.pathophysiology: Stretching of Cooper’s ligaments, skin laxity, loss of glandular tissue support.
entries.management: Mastopexy (breast lift), supportive bras, treat underlying cause, patient education.

entries.name: Female Breast Asymmetrical
entries.definition: Noticeable difference in Area, shape, or position between the two breasts.
entries.pathophysiology: Asymmetric development of glandular/adipose tissue, scarring, mass effect.
entries.management: Reassurance, augmentation/reduction, mastopexy, treat underlying cause, psychological support.

entries.name: Stretch Marks (Striae)
entries.definition: Linear atrophic bands on skin, initially red/purple, later white, due to dermal tearing.
entries.pathophysiology: Disruption of dermal collagen/elastin, skin stretching, hormonal effects.
characteristics: Linear, atrophic, hypopigmented or erythematous bands on abdomen, thighs, breasts, buttocks
entries.management: Topical retinoids, laser therapy, treat underlying cause, reassurance, cosmetic camouflage.

entries.name: Breast Pain (Mastalgia)
entries.definition: Persistent pain in one/both breasts, cyclical or non-cyclical.
entries.pathophysiology: Increased breast tissue sensitivity to hormones (estrogen/progesterone).
entries.management: NSAIDs, supportive bras, evening primrose oil, hormonal therapy (severe cases).

entries.name: Nipple Retraction
entries.definition: Inversion of nipple (acquired or congenital).
entries.pathophysiology: Fibrosis/shortening of lactiferous ducts.
entries.management: Treat underlying cause (antibiotics for infection, surgery for malignancy).
